title: Full-Time Optometrist
description:
### Job Description
VisionCare Associates is seeking a motivated and compassionate Optometrist to join our thriving practice in the heart of New York City. We are a full-scope practice with a focus on primary eye care, contact lenses, and the management of ocular disease.

### Responsibilities
* Perform comprehensive eye examinations for patients of all ages.
* Diagnose and manage a wide range of ocular diseases, including glaucoma, macular degeneration, and diabetic retinopathy.
* Prescribe and fit contact lenses, including specialty lenses.
* Co-manage post-operative surgical patients.
* Provide patient education on eye health and preventative care.
* Maintain accurate and detailed patient records.

### Qualifications
* Doctor of Optometry (O.D.) degree from an accredited optometry school.
* License to practice optometry in the state of New York.
* Therapeutic Pharmaceutical Agent (TPA) certification.
* Strong clinical and communication skills.
* A passion for providing exceptional patient care.
* New graduates are welcome to apply.

### Benefits
* Competitive salary and bonus structure.
* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance.
* 401(k) with company match.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* Continuing education allowance.
* Malpractice insurance coverage.

title: Pediatric Optometrist
description:
### Job Description
Bright Eyes Clinic is a leading pediatric eye care center looking for a dedicated Part-Time Optometrist to join our team. We specialize in providing comprehensive vision care for children in a friendly and welcoming environment.

### Responsibilities
* Perform eye exams tailored for pediatric patients, including infants and toddlers.
* Diagnose and manage common childhood vision problems such as amblyopia, strabismus, and refractive errors.
* Work closely with parents to educate them on their child's vision health.
* Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to provide integrated care.

### Qualifications
* Doctor of Optometry (O.D.) degree.
* Residency or demonstrated experience in pediatric optometry is highly preferred.
* Excellent interpersonal skills and a patient, gentle demeanor with children.
* Licensed to practice in California.

### Benefits
* Flexible part-time schedule.
* Competitive hourly rate.
* Opportunity to make a real impact in the community.
* A fun and supportive team environment.
